required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cryoablation Combined With Camrelizumab and Apatinib for Multiprimary Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study on the Safety and Efficacy of Cryoablation Combined With Camrelizumab and Apatinib in the Treatment of Multiprimary Lung Cancer With Non-known Driving Genes

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: This study is to observe the safety and therapeutic effect of cryoablation combined with pd-1 antibody immunotherapy and anti-angiogenesis therapy in multiple primary lung cancer (MPLC) patients.
Methods: In this study, 20 patients with MPLC who conform to the admission criteria are enrolled and began to receive treatment with Camrelizumab combined with Apatinib after cryoablation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects who meet the admission criteria will be treated with Camrelizumab and Apatinib until disease progression, intolerable toxicity, death, withdrawal of the patient or the researchers determined that the drug must be discontinued.
The primary end point of this study is safety of cryoablation combined with carillizumab and apatinib for MPLC. The secondary endpoints include objective response rate, disease control rate, time to progression, progression free survival and overall survival. Exploratory endpoint is to explore biomarkers in tumor tissue and blood that could potentially predict the efficacy of Camrelizumab and Apatinib.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: About two to three weeks after cryoablation, Eligible patients sign informed consent and then begin treating with Camrelizumab and Apatinib.

primary_outcome.description: The occurrence of grade 3 to 5 adverse reactions was assessed by CTC AE v5.0

other_outcome.description: To explore biomarkers in tumor tissue and blood that could potentially predict the efficacy of Camrelizumab and Apatinib like PD-L1, ctDNA, CEA， CA125， CA153.

arm_group.description: Camrelizumab, iv, Q3W until progression disease or intolerable toxicity or 2 years Apatinib, po, QD until progression disease or intolerable toxicity or 2 years

intervention.description: Camrelizumab, iv, Q3W; Apatinib, po, QD

responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy Director of Guangzhou Institute of Respiratory Disease
